title: Data Engineer- Costco Logistics BI
description: Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the third largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in fourteen countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco ranks seventh in Forbes "World's Best Employers". This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco's success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. Come join the Costco Wholesale IT family. Costco IT is a dynamic, fast-paced environment, working through exciting transformation efforts. We are building the next generation retail environment where you will be surrounded by dedicated and highly professional employees. The Data Engineer - Costco Logistics BI is responsible for the end to end data pipelines to power Costco Logistics reporting. This role is focused on data engineering to build and deliver automated data pipelines from a plethora of internal and external data sources. The Data Engineer will partner with product owners, engineering and data platform teams to design, build, test, and automate data pipelines that are relied upon across the company as the single source of truth. If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide BEST companies "to work for", simply apply and let your career be reimagined.<p><br></p>ROLE<p><br></p>Develops and operationalizes data pipelines to make data available for consumption (Costco Logistics BI).<p><br></p>Works with data architects and data/BI engineers to design data pipelines and recommends ongoing optimization of data storage, data ingestion, data quality, and orchestration.<p><br></p>Designs, develops, and implements ETL/ELT processes using IICS (Informatica Cloud).<p><br></p>Uses MySQL to improve and speed up delivery of our data products and services.<p><br></p>Uses Azure services such as Azure SQL DW (Synapse), ADLS, Azure Event Hub, Azure Data Factory to improve and speed up delivery of our data products and services.<p><br></p>Implements big data and NoSQL solutions by developing scalable data processing platforms to drive high-value insights to the organization.<p><br></p>Identifies, designs, and implements internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery.<p><br></p>Identifies ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality of data management.<p><br></p>Communicates technical concepts to non-technical audiences both written and verbal.<p><br></p>Performs peer reviews for other data engineer's work.<p><br></p><strong><u>Required</u></strong><p><br></p>3+ years' experience engineering and operationalizing data pipelines with large and complex datasets.<p><br></p>2+ years' experience with Informatica PowerCenter.<p><br></p>2+ years' experience with Informatica IICS.<p><br></p>2+ years' experience working with Cloud technologies; such as ADLS, Azure Databricks, Spark, Azure Synapse, Cosmos DB, and other big data technologies.<p><br></p>2+ years' experience with Data Modeling, ETL, and Data Warehousing.<p><br></p>2+ years' experience implementing data integration techniques such as event / message based integration (Kafka, Azure Event Hub), ETL.<p><br></p>2+ years' experience with Git / Azure DevOps.<p><br></p>Extensive experience working with various data sources; SQL, Sql Server database, flat files (csv, delimited), Web API, XML.<p><br></p>Advanced SQL skills; Understanding of relational databases, business data, and the ability to write complex SQL queries against a variety of data sources.<p><br></p>Strong understanding of database storage concepts; Data Lake, Relational Databases, NoSQL, Graph, Data Warehousing.<p><br></p>Able to work in a fast-paced agile development environment. Recommended<p><br></p>Microsoft Azure/similar certifications.<p><br></p>Experience delivering data solutions through agile software development methodologies.<p><br></p>Experience with PowerShell, Python or similar scripting language.<p><br></p>Experience with UC4 Job Scheduler.<p><br></p>Exposure to the retail industry.<p><br></p>Excellent verbal and written communication skills.<p><br></p>BA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent software/services experience.<p><br></p>Required Documents<p><br></p>Cover Letter<p><br></p>Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Pay Ranges: Level 1 - $75,000 - $110,000 Level 2 - $100,000 - $135,000 We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, health benefits - medical/dental/vision/hearing aid/pharmacy/behavioral health/employee assistance, health care reimbursement account, dependent care assistance plan, short-term disability and long-term disability insurance, AD&amp;D insurance, life insurance, 401(k), stock purchase plan to eligible employees. Costco is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Costco is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request to IT-Recruiting@costco.com If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas. PDN-9965b219-1097-47d8-80b2-1b483893f4af

title: Junior Windows Engineer
description: We are looking for a Windows Engineer to join our multi-tenant hosting team. You’ll be responsible for the design, implementation, and health of our domain architecture including but not limited to Active Directory, authentication technologies, and DNS. As part of Epic's hosting team, you'll enjoy opportunities to keep abreast of the latest technologies and work collaboratively with experts in a variety of knowledge areas to ensure a robust and secure environment that forms the foundation of our hosting service. Learn more about the team at https //careers.epic.com/Jobs/Hosting.<p><br></p><strong><u>Desired Skills And Knowledge Areas</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Expertise in Active Directory design and maintenance</li><li> Expertise in automation using scripting tools like Powershell</li><li> Experience with AD trusts and replication</li><li> Experience administering Azure Active Directory and Azure Active Directory Connect</li><li> Experience with deployment and troubleshooting of DNS &amp; DHCP</li><li> Knowledge of configuration management tools like Puppet, Chef, or Ansible</li><li> Knowledge of Active Directory Federation Services</li><li> Knowledge of authentication technologies Kerberos, LDAP, SAML</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>More than just important work</strong>.<p><br></p>Epic is located in Madison, Wisconsin, a city regularly ranked as one of America's best places to live. Epic's environment is one of continuous learning; you'll have access to opportunities to expand your skill set and share your knowledge with others. We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity employer. We seek diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences in our mission to improve healthcare. Research has shown that job-seekers who are women, LGBTQ+, or members of the global majority are less likely to apply for roles they don't seem completely qualified for, so we encourage all who are interested to apply. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO.<p><br></p>This position features three different starting points, based upon prior experience.<p><br></p><em>Junior Windows Engineer</em> requires 0-2 years prior experience<p><br></p><em>Windows Engineer</em> requires 2-5 years prior experience<p><br></p><em>Senior Windows Engineer</em> requires 5+ years prior experience<p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>A history of academic and professional success</li><li>Eligibility to work in the U.S. without visa sponsorship.</li><li>Troubleshooting skills and good customer service are required</li><li>Relocation to the Madison, WI, area (reimbursed)</li><li>Available to work 1st, 2nd, or 3rd shift</li><li>COVID-19 vaccination</li></ul><p><br></p>As a member of the Hosting team at Epic you'll be responsible for the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of Epic Hosting. Those responsibilities include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Following policies and procedures and escalating when policies or procedures are not followed</li><li>Escalating potential security incidents and providing relevant information</li><li>Meeting all security responsibilities defined in policies and procedures</li></ul>

title: Integration Engineer
description: <strong>Make a meaningful impact by creating bridges that improve healthcare.</strong><p><br></p>Modern medicine has hundreds of specializations that depend on data from many niche systems to make informed decisions. In Epic's quest to help healthcare providers deliver the highest quality of patient care, we rely on the Integration Engineers on our EDI team to share information across disparate systems and make it easily accessible within a single patient record. Each project this group of experts tackles presents a unique set of challenges; if you enjoy variety, you've found your sweet spot.<p><br></p>Your mission use your coding smarts, analytical skills, existing international standards and your breadth of knowledge to figure out ingenious ways to access, convert, and display this data to the end users of Epic's software. Your know-how won't be limited to the technical realm; both Epic and customer teams will look to you to provide sound advice for implementation strategies and project management.<p><br></p>You'll make a positive impact from day one as part of a collaborative and committed team of technical peers, and will enjoy opportunities to grow toward your strengths and what interests you most.<p><br></p><strong>More than just important work</strong>.<p><br></p>Epic is located in Madison, Wisconsin, a city regularly ranked as one of America's best places to live. Epic's environment is one of continuous learning; you'll have access to opportunities to expand your skill set and share your knowledge with others. We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. description: <strong><u>Position Summary<br><br></u></strong>Program all CNC Lathes and CNC Machine Centers to form precision metal parts and components utilizing appropriate shop equipment (CNC mills, lathes, grinders, etc.) in a timely and efficient manner with minimal supervision. Plans numerical control program to control contour path machining of metal parts on automatic machine tools.<br><br><strong><u>Essential Functions<br></u></strong><ul><li> Uses G-Code and/or software program such as Mastercam to program CNC machines.</li><li> Analyzes drawings, sketches, and design data of part to determine dimension and configuration of cuts, plan sequence of operations, selection/mfg. of cutting tools, fixtures and machine speeds and feed rates to assure efficient use of tools and time.</li><li> Installs collets, bushings, and bar pullers in stock-feeding mechanism, using wrenches and screwdrivers.</li><li> Positions and secures tools in tool holders, verifying positions with gauges and other measuring instruments.</li><li> Computes angular and linear dimensions, radii, and curvatures, and outlines sequence of operations required to machine part.</li><li> Writes instruction sheets and cutter lists to guide setup and operation of machine.</li><li> Writes program of machine instructions in symbolic language to encode direct numerical control database to regulate movement of machine along cutting path.</li><li> Revises program to eliminate instruction errors or omissions, if necessary.</li><li> Observes operation of machine on trial run to prove programmed instructions.</li><li> Perform mechanical tasks including loading and unloading vices, fixtures and parts.</li><li> Establish and set appropriate tool offsets.</li><li> Loads material, starts machine, observes operation, and verifies conformance to specifications of first-run, sample work pieces and in-process parts, using such instruments as fixed gauges, calipers and micrometers.</li><li> Runs machine through cycle, stopping machine and adjusting tool positions and machine controls to allow for such factors as timing, clearance between moving parts, and chip removal.</li><li> Maintain statistical process control charts by reading and recording measurements when required.</li><li> Visually inspect production for burrs, scrapes, rust and other defects.</li><li> Replace worn tools.</li><li> Operates bench grinder or cutter-grinding machine to sharpen tools.</li><li> Sets up machines for other workers; instructs workers and provide information as needed.</li><li> Responsible for maintenance of machine, including but not limited to lubrication and adjustment and repairs of equipment per manufacturer's manual.</li><li> Update data collection system at beginning and end of each task using barcode scanning and basic data entry.</li><li> Maintain organized and clean work area.</li><li> Receive, understand and follow all written and oral instruction.</li><li> Timely completion of all paperwork associated with position including move tags</li><li> Comply with all company policies and procedures including safety and attendance requirements.</li><li> Participate in activities to increase personal skill level, overall departmental processes and product quality.</li><li> Resolve day-to-day issues by working effectively with others and communicating problems with supervisor.</li><li> Maintain meet or exceed rating on all performance evaluations.</li><li> Follow the company safety rules and other job-related instructions and to perform other job-related duties as requested, subject to all applicable state and federal laws.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Skills And Abilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Minimum of 2 years of trade school, vocational education, work experience, or apprenticeship.</li><li> Ability to use a variety of lathes, drill presses, and equipment including tumblers, air hose, hoists, wrenches, tool-holders, vices, etc.</li><li> Mechanical ability to operate equipment</li><li> Blue print reading skills</li><li> Basic math and English skills for part count, written and verbal work instruction.</li><li> Ability to monitor machine sounds to identify changes in order to alert department lead.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Physical Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Stand, walk, push, pull, reach overhead, and bend to the floor.</li><li> Lift, carry and move up to 50 pounds of parts and/or equipment occasionally throughout the workday.</li><li> Ability to use a variety of milling machines, drill presses, and equipment including tumblers, air hose, hoists, wrenches, tool-holders, vises, etc.</li><li> 20/20 vision with or without correction</li><li> Use of hands 100% of the workday</li><li> Ability to work in shop environment, exposure to high noise levels, moving equipment and machinery; exposure to dust, fumes and mist; exposure to chemicals including oils and cutting fluids.</li><li> Ability to monitor machine sounds to identify changes in order to alert department lead.<br></li></ul>We offer a 401k plan with 4% company match, BlueCross BlueShield Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance, Health Savings Account (HSA), Life Insurance, Short Term Disability Insurance, Attendance Award Program (can earn up to 2-additional PTO days per year by earning perfect attendance), an air conditioned 108,000 sq. foot facility, a great work environment and other benefits.<br><br>EOE

The Costco Digital team is looking for a skilled React.js Front End Full Stack Engineer that will perform development work. The Full Stack Engineer must have a strong focus on front-end development and demonstrate the ability to work in a fast-paced environment. This role will also be directly responsible for delivering capabilities to create delightful user experiences for our members, and maintaining them through functional improvement, documentation, profiling, and front-end performance enhancements. The Full Stack Engineer will design and build modern user interface components to enhance our member experience over a wide variety of digital touchpoints. Our Digital team is transforming how we deliver solutions and interact with our members across our Mobile, Commerce and Order Management platforms. SDLC.<p><br></p>Develops and implements front-end architecture to support user interface concepts.<p><br></p>Adopts technical ownership of features and advancing product functionality.<p><br></p>Meets robustness.<p><br></p>Self-motivated with a positive, can-do attitude.<p><br></p>Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business, including weekends, holidays, and a rotational on call basis as required.
